means: creep ： 多指人或四足动物匍匐爬行，尤指偷偷地或不出声地缓慢向前爬行。也指植物的蔓延生长等。
climb ： 通常指用手或足爬上或爬下，也指飞机、日、月的上升，还可用作比喻。
crawl ： 指人或动物以身躯贴着地面缓慢地移动。

sentence.Network_en: The traffic on the approach road slowed to a crawl.
As he tried to crawl away, he was hit in the shoulder.
sentence.Network_cn: 他试图爬走时肩膀中枪了。

sentence.Network_en: I was heading on a secret mission that made my flesh crawl.
sentence.Network_cn: 我正要执行一项让我心惊肉跳的秘密任务。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: of unknown origin; possibly related to Swedish kravla and Danish kravle

encyclopedia.content: 解释翻译 1.爬，爬行，蠕动 2.缓慢地移动，徐徐行进 3.锛埑Ｓ媒惺憋級锛埼妫系蕊級爬满，充斥着[(+with)] 4.锛堄捎诳志澹岫竦蕊級起鸡皮疙瘩，汗毛直竖 5.谄媚奉承，巴结[(+to)] 6.用爬式锛埢蜃杂墒斤級游泳 7.锛堉参镲級蔓延，蔓生 网络释义 搜索引擎常用的抓取系统，其的功能包括：网页抓取、抓取调度、域名解析、死链检测、JavaScript执行等。

entry.def: When you crawl, you move forward on your hands and knees.

example.ex: Don't worry if your baby seems a little reluctant to crawl or walk...
example.tran: 如果你的宝宝不爱爬也不爱走，不要担心。

example.ex: I began to crawl on my hands and knees towards the door...
example.tran: 我开始手脚并用朝门口爬去。

entry.def: When an insect crawls somewhere, it moves there quite slowly.

example.ex: I watched the moth crawl up the outside of the lampshade.
example.tran: 我看着飞蛾爬到灯罩外面。

entry.def: If someone or something crawls somewhere, they move or progress slowly or with great difficulty.

example.ex: I crawled out of bed at nine-thirty...
example.tran: 我9点半才勉强从床上爬起来。

example.ex: They had not foreseen the higher inflation in France when most of Western Europe was crawling out of recession...
example.tran: 当西欧的大多数国家正从经济衰退中缓慢复苏时，他们并没有预见到法国的通货膨胀率会升高。

entry.def: If you say that a place is crawling with people or animals, you are emphasizing that it is full of them.

example.ex: This place is crawling with police.
...rock-hard earth littered with rubbish and crawling with vermin.
example.tran: 丢满垃圾、爬满虫子的坚硬土地

entry.def: The crawl is a kind of swimming stroke which you do lying on your front, swinging one arm over your head, and then the other arm.
If something makes your skin crawl or makes your flesh crawl, it makes you feel shocked or disgusted.

example.ex: I hated this man, his very touch made my skin crawl.
example.tran: 我讨厌这个男人，他碰我一下我都觉得恶心。

means.word_mean: 2. a swimming stroke; arms are moved alternately overhead accompanied by a flutter kick
3. a slow creeping mode of locomotion (on hands and knees or dragging the body);

sentences.sentence: "a crawl was all that the injured man could manage"

means.word_mean: 1. move slowly; in the case of people or animals with the body near the ground;

sentences.sentence: "The crocodile was crawling along the riverbed"

means.word_mean: 2. feel as if crawling with insects;

sentences.sentence: "The old cheese was crawling with maggots"
"European children learn the breast stroke; they often don't know how to crawl"

means.word_mean: 爬, 爬行; 徐缓而行

sentences.en: We learn to crawl before we learn to walk.
sentences.cn: 我们学会走路之前先要学会爬。

jushi.english: We learn to crawl before we learn to walk.
jushi.chinese: 我们学会走路之前先要学会爬。

jushi.english: Traffic was moving at a crawl.
